laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased protein content (82 mg/dL) with normal cell count. Oligoclonal IgG bands restricted to CSF were also detected.
Multiple T2-hyperintense lesions in the pons, paraventricular region, and corpus callosum without gadolinium enhancement.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased T2-lesion load and one Gd-enhancing lesion in the pons at 3-year follow-up.
Marked prolongation of P100 wave latency noted during a follow-up assessment.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Tachycardia to the 130s with an ejection fraction of 42% and segmental left ventricular dysfunction.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Heart rate normalized approximately 2 hours after the onset of tachycardia.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Peak troponin T was 0.06 ng/mL (normal range 0.00 to 0.09 ng/mL).
Normal hearing on the left side with a 30 dB loss at 8 kHz on the right side.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: None specified, but hearing loss fluctuations were noted.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Moderate loss of myelinated fibers, thinly myelinated fibers, and multi-layered onion bulbs consistent with chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy.
